intro: Silene solenantha, commonly known as the long-stalked catchfly, is a flowering plant native to the western United States and parts of Canada. It belongs to the Caryophyllaceae family, which includes many other flowering plants with showy blooms. The plant typically grows in dry, open habitats such as meadows and rocky slopes. It produces small, pinkish-white flowers that bloom in late spring to early summer. Its leaves are linear and hairy, and it is often found in association with other alpine or arctic flora.
